programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Memorial Day (2011)
programme.desc: A Second World War veteran offers to tell his grandson the stories behind his service in the conflict. Years later, the child has grown up to also become a soldier, and finds the old man's tales help him to cope with the challenges he faces serving in Iraq. Drama, starring Jonathan Bennett and James Cromwell, with his real-life son John playing his character as a younger man

programme.title: Circus of Horrors (1960)
programme.desc: Anton Diffring stars as a deranged plastic surgeon who offers crooks the chance to start afresh by providing them with a new appearance - on condition that they staff his run-down circus. It's not long before some of his customers decide to renege on the deal and escape his clutches - prompting him to embark on a murderous spree. Top-class chiller, a genre classic and must-see for aficionados of Sixties horror films, with Donald Pleasance giving his all as an unfortunate ringmaster, alongside Erika Remberg, Yvonne Monlaur and Jane Hylton

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers (2001)
programme.desc: A brother and sister are driving home from college when they witness a mysterious truck driver disposing of what appears to be a human corpse at an isolated building. They are soon hunted by the strange motorist, who is not what he appears to be. Horror, starring Gina Philips, Justin Long and Jonathan Breck

programme.title: Wind Chill (2007)
programme.desc: A college student eager to get home for Christmas accepts a lift from a classmate. In an attempt to reach their destination before a severe storm hits them, the pair take a shortcut down a remote country lane, where they are run off the road by a speeding vehicle. As the stranded duo face the harsh winter elements with no food, water or heat, they gradually begin to suspect they are not alone. Thriller, starring Emily Blunt, Ashton Holmes and Martin Donovan

As he tries to help her, however, he finds himself drawn into a deadly underworld society of lycanthropic killers planning a mass slaughter - and soon discovers that even her parents are not all they seem. Horror sequel, starring Julie Delpy, Tom Everett Scott, Vince Vieluf and Phil Buckman

John Carpenter's sci-fi horror remake, starring Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, TK Carter, Keith David and Richard Dysart

Presenter Rav Wilding also looks at how data captured by mobile phone masts helped bring a pair of prolific burglars to justice and how smart number plate recognition cameras can detect when a car is on false plates

Plus, efforts are made to catch a trader selling chocolate bars with a fake list of ingredients, putting children's health at risk

This little doll of a sailor was named Fairstar after the ship he was bought on, and the ship that carried Sarah and her parents to Australia in the 1960s as 'Ten Pound Poms' - people encouraged to emigrate to Australia by the government with cheap fares. A mid-century camera and a child's musical chair are also rejuvenated

programme.desc: After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a 150,000 investment

A well-loved family recipe book and an art deco clock also receive much-needed restorations

They arrange to meet the mysterious contact they suspect is also operating undercover as they set about investigating the seemingly shady Superintendent Edwards by breaking into her office. Meanwhile, a revelation from PCSO Pricey causes Dom to believe that Clinton may not have been what he seemed. programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie hilariously poke fun at life with celebrity guests. programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Madison and Oly attend a protest rampage, dragging a nervous Michael along for the ride. Oly's hangover leads to a big parenting fail, while a confusing encounter between Jacinda and Santi's new girlfriend distracts her away from Reema's return from London. Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Photograph (2020)
programme.desc: Michael, a reporter, becomes fascinated by a picture of a woman, and wants to know her backstory. In the present day, following the death of her estranged mother, a devastated young woman finds a photo that will change her life forever. Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple to find a new home in the Northumberland countryside on a 375,000 budget so that they can live closer to their families

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year, where quality controller Stuart Jones shows him the speciality flour that includes 13 varieties of wheat. Cherry Healey learns the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite - Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of our obsession with toasting our baked goods

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef explores the county of Gloucestershire and the Cotswolds, where he cooks a River Severn salmon with asparagus and Hollandaise. James also rustles up ham croquettes with garlic rapeseed mayo, and hears from one farmer who thinks his land produces the country's best virgin rapeseed oil

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Adam Henson finds out about lavender and its benefits and Margherita Taylor learns about the decline of wild meadows and what can be done to help. Mary Berry demonstrates what to do with a harvest of summer fruits when she makes a tasty smoothie

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: In the south-west of Japan, the Ryukyu Islands stretch towards the tropics and all life on them is influenced by the power of the sea, with volcanos and typhoons forces to be reckoned with. Michelle Dockery narrates a journey beginning at an island at the top of the chain and travelling south, revealing unexpected stories of isolation, unique wildlife and unsolved mysteries

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The two finalists go head to head, each taking on the redesign of a trendy bar in London's vibrant Soho district. They have three days to make over the ground-floor bar and an intimate basement cocktail lounge - and to help, both contestants have a fellow team-mate, plus a team of trades. One designer goes all-out, relocating the bar to the other side of the room - but the more they rip out, the more it becomes a demolition zone. Down the road, there is indecision and angst as the other finalist realises just how much is at stake. Who will win the career-defining contract to design an upmarket apartment on the Cornish coast?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Bletchley Park in Buckinghamshire, where antique experts Charlie Ross and Mark Stacey find an autograph book and a tea set

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across the vast and beautiful Morecambe Bay, where he joins one of the town's last shrimpers to find out how potted shrimp is made, From there, Michael makes his way to Arnside on the Furness Line, where he discovers a magnificently quirky 17th century garden, and across the Arnside viaduct, he reaches Cartmel and its 12th century priory and a Michelin-starred restaurant

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to a farmer's field in Rutland to examine evidence of a Roman barn conversion, featuring a three-room spa, including underfloor and in-wall central heating. She also finds out about the excavation of one of Henry VIII's lost forts in Hull, and hears from a team that discovered stunning 10,000-year-old hunting tools near Scarborough

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The BBC gardening team present the sights and sounds of the famous events, with highlights of the gardens and tips for amateur horticulturists

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: The FBI joins the investigation into the attack on the 2017 Las Vegas Harvest music festival, as doctors concentrate resources on treating the wounded most likely to survive at overwhelmed local hospitals. The lobby of the Tropicana Hotel looks like a disaster zone as it is strewn with concert-goers seeking shelter, while country music superstar Jason Aldean, his wife and band members are hunkered down in a tour bus riddled with bullet holes

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: A look at the impact the attack on the 2017 Las Vegas Harvest music festival had on survivors. Many are still searching for closure, while for some the bond they formed that night with strangers restored their faith in humanity, while for others activism is a way to channel their grief

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: When an armed gang of jewellery thieves robs 300,000 worth of gold from a Birmingham jewellery store, police need to use forensic evidence to track down the gold. West Midland Police's Force Priorities Unit, a specialist team tasked with completing the most high risk jobs and manhunts, swarm the local area to find witnesses and CCTV that could give them a lead

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A couple catch three masked men trying to steal a catalytic converter from under a car parked on their driveway, and capture the incident on a smartphone

programme.title: Rip Off Britain

Plus, more frustration for customers of Britain's most complained about pay TV provider and, how one woman ended up with a 5000 bill for a car accident that wasn't her fault because she unwittingly dialled the wrong number

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Congenital heart surgeon Osama Jaber must perform lifesaving surgery on 15-day-old baby Callie-Mae, who was born with the two large arteries of her heart, the aorta and the pulmonary, in the wrong positions, meaning her body is not getting enough oxygenated blood. Neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on 30-year-old Sam, who suffers from debilitating headaches, as she was born with a condition where the lower part of the brain pushes down onto her spine, putting pressure on the brainstem and spinal cord

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TIkTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin explores the fertile plains and lowlands of eastern Scotland to help understand why Scottish whisky reflects the landscape in which it is made. He also discovers why the raspberries grown near Strathmore are a sought-after ingredient, and to finish, he prepares whisky-cured salmon with a beetroot dressing, and blinis and a raspberry panna cotta with mini doughnuts

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: John Craven highlights some top spots for birdwatching in the UK, Sean Fletcher finds nature in the most unlikely of places when he visits a nature trail at Manchester airport and James Martin cooks up a tasty rustic recipe on the barbecue when he makes veal escalopes with salsa verde

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: The documentary examining the wildlife of the east Asian country focuses on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island and a place totally unlike the rest of the country. Every year it swings from a bitter Siberian winter into the warmth of a Mediterranean-like summer, with the thaw revealing a landscape changed beyond all recognition. It takes hardy animals and tough people with real ingenuity to survive in this ever-changing place. Michelle Dockery narrates

programme.title: Ancient Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Michael Scott employs the latest 3D-scanning technology and virtual reality to reveal the historical secrets of Cairo and Ancient Egypt. He explores the first pyramid ever built at Saqqara and finds out how it helped inspire the Great Pyramid of Giza. With access to robbers' tunnels and hidden chambers normally closed to the public, the presenter uses laser scans to help understand how the pyramids were built and shows how the Great Pyramid was designed and constructed. Michael then investigates the Sphinx and tries to determine which pharaoh is represented in the face of the legendary monument

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: In the great nave of Norwich Cathedral, experts Kate Bateman and David Fletcher pick out some chose items to take to auction. Among them are an enamel topped silver trinket box and a vintage model car. Plus, presenter Paul Martin uncovers the meaning of religious graffiti

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels though Cumbria, setting sail in a small craft on Lake Windermere with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's children's books Swallows and Amazons. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks, and discovers researchers are exploring how slagbanks could contribute to reducing atmospheric carbon dioxide.

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: Actor Brian Cox talks about his journey from poverty in Dundee to success in Hollywood. Sitting down with Amol Rajan he shares the secrets of his hit show Succession, revealing what happens on set, his best and worst moments since the show first aired in 2018, and his thoughts about the method acting technique used by one of his co-stars

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets sail through the Kyles of Bute to the Holy Loch and on to Ardentinny, his childhood home overlooking Loch Long. He also discovers a Viking connection in the shape of a vintage sailing boat that takes him to scale the heights of the people's mountain - The Cobbler

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and the BBC gardening team celebrate the passions behind the plants and gardens on show. Adam Frost uncovers the innovative design details hidden in the gardens, while Nick Bailey investigates how to future-proof planting choices ahead of a summer scorcher. Joe revels in the beauty of a houseplant favourite - the orchid - and Arit Anderson provides inspiration for gardens with the statement plants on display

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about the wave of industrial action that engulfed the UK at the end of 2022, with access to union leaders including Mick Lynch of the RMT and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nursing. The opening edition charts the start of the strikes, with Lynch and the National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers at the forefront of the movement, with nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the Royal College of Nursing.union's 106-year history

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Joe and Chas have been together for nine years, a long time to be truly in love with someone. But how long does it take to properly say goodbye? Darkly comic tale, written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with a guest appearance from Sheila Reid

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: The FBI joins the investigation into the attack on the 2017 Las Vegas Harvest music festival, as doctors concentrate resources on treating the wounded most likely to survive at overwhelmed local hospitals. The lobby of the Tropicana Hotel looks like a disaster zone as it is strewn with concert-goers seeking shelter, while country music superstar Jason Aldean, his wife and band members are hunkered down in a tour bus riddled with bullet holes

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: A look at the impact the attack on the 2017 Las Vegas Harvest music festival had on survivors. Many are still searching for closure, while for some the bond they formed that night with strangers restored their faith in humanity, while for others activism is a way to channel their grief

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and Ashley John-Baptiste put the three-second rule to the test and investigate the 'Lion Diet' social media trend. Liam and Helen share the story of their diagnosis with mesothelioma, a cancer caused by asbestos that is completely preventable. Plus, the story of a woman who faked a DNA paternity test to deny her ex-partner access to his child

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: Following investigations into serious crimes, revealing the crucial role cutting-edge forensic science plays in bringing criminals to justice

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores North Radnorshire and Montgomeryshire. He begins his journey on a beautiful pasture at Tylcau Hill near Llanbister bursting with colour from wildflowers and rare butterflies. Next stop is Dolfor near Newtown, one of the last remaining strongholds for the curlew in Wales

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must prepare two courses that will impress not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also from the 2014 series Ping Coombes, the 2015 series Simon Wood and 2020 series finalist Claire Fyfe

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, searching for three items with the potential to be revived. She saves a pine chest of drawers for carpenter Martin Hough and a trio of utility chairs for upcycler Sarah Peterson. Sarah takes on a set of trestle table bases for her own project

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the Dry Garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol Klein reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. With a ban on peat in compost on the way, Arit Anderson investigates what that means for the industry and gardeners alike

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin visits Northern Ireland in the hope of gaining an understanding of the rich flavours of the beef from native cattle the Dexter. He also visits the east coast, where he discovers why local lobsters are so prized by chefs, and cooks up a Goan lobster curry, and a fillet of Dexter beef served with a garlic and parsley risotto with caramelised onions

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing seeks inspiration for his kitchen garden when he visits an expert herb grower in Bristol. Wildlife artist Robert Fuller reveals the species that thrive near his home in North Yorkshire during the summer months, and Nadiya Hussain learns how to smoke fish and shows how to make a delicious smoked haddock rarebit

programme.title: Big Cats About the House
programme.desc: Following the work of big cat expert Giles Clark, as he embarks on a mission to transform the Big Cat Sanctuary in Kent into a centre of global excellence for conservation. In the opening episode, Giles provides around the clock care to Maya, a five-day-old black jaguar cub neglected by her mother. Then, he travels to Cambodia to witness the dilemma clouded leopards are facing in the wild

programme.title: Ancient Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Michael Scott uses 3D scanning technology to reveal the historical secrets of ancient Athens and tell the story of how this remarkable city created the world's first democracy. He begins his journey on the Acropolis, where, in the late sixth century BC the people of Athens overthrew a tyrant and set up a democracy, and investigates a mysterious, asymmetrical temple called the Erechtheion that sits in the shadow of the world-famous Parthenon. To the south of the city, he clambers through a silver mine where an army of slaves once toiled inside the labyrinth of narrow tunnels

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the RAF Museum at Hendon in London, where items up for auction include a nautilus shell and some Superman film memorabilia. With antiques experts Michael Baggott and Mark Stacey

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the last leg of his railway journey around the north-west coast of England, visiting the childhood home of William Wordsworth in Cockermouth, Cumbria, and ending in Maryport, where the Solway Firth marks the border between England and Scotland

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Diana Yates demonstrate how to produce home-made fertiliser using comfrey, while George Anderson has an update from his own garden in Joppa and Beechgrove's head gardener Scott Smith reveals how to spot when seedlings are ready for potting on

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson discovers more about the quiet village of Ravenglass in the Lake District's National Park, which played a strategic role in the Roman empire. With the help of the Pennington family, whose ancestral home is Muncaster Castle, Ben is shown their latest Roman find, a unique stone slab with a Latin inscription that's been attributed to a Roman naval unit, Aelia Classica

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The BBC gardening team present the sights and sounds of the famous events, with highlights of the gardens and tips for amateur horticulturists

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The curators continue their restoration of Paul McCartney's childhood home in Liverpool, trying to track down a key section of wallpaper for the living room, and opening up a room the public has not yet seen - the bedroom where the former Beatle's parents slept. Across town, a project is under way to catalogue and clean a vast collection of photographs discovered in a four-storey Georgian house that was once the home and studio of Edward Chambr Hardman, one of Britain's most significant photographers

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy and Lance have one last day on the farm to pull out all the stops and find the gold. Plus, Terry's got a new gazebo, the perfect time for a rally

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Documentary about the wave of industrial action that engulfed the UK at the end of 2022, with access to union leaders including Mick Lynch of the RMT and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nursing. The opening edition charts the start of the strikes, with Lynch and the National Union of Rail, Maritime and Transport Workers at the forefront of the movement, with nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the Royal College of Nursing.union's 106-year history

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Lagerfeld
programme.desc: Award-winning director Michael Waldman goes in search of the real Karl Lagerfeld, who was one of the most flamboyant and recognisable figures in fashion, but also one of the most mysterious. Waldman tracks down those closest to the designer, including his friends, neighbour, lawyer, doctor, bodyguard and Chanel colleagues. He also meets the agent and nanny left in charge of Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, who he called the love of his life and who earned an estimated three million euros from modelling assignments

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The two finalists are challenged to make over two pubs in a busy tourist hotspot in Brighton. One designer will be transforming an award-winning gastro pub with a field to fork ethos, while the other competitor is tasked with turning a traditional pub into a fun day-to-night venue aimed at a younger clientele. Once the challenge is compete, the pair head back to the design studio where they are cross examined by Alan and the judges. Who will be crowned this year's winner?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the universe at the smallest scales, from tiny atoms to vast galaxies. The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science

programme.title: Lucky Sunil
programme.desc: Andrew Davies's satirical drama telling the story of Sunil, an Indian law student who travels to London in the hope of making it big. But he finds his new life is not quite as easy as he expected it to be, and descends into a world of hefty debts and dodgy deals among Britain's Asian emigres. Starring Kulvinder Ghir. Originally broadcast in 1988

programme.title: Andrew Davies: Rewriting the Classics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creative process of the screenwriter behind some of TV's most acclaimed adaptations of classic literature, from the 1995 version of Pride and Prejudice to the 2018 dramatisation of Victor Hugo's Les Miserables. He also discusses how to go about transforming sprawling, lengthy and detailed novels into primetime drama, turning one art form into another altogether different one. With contributions from authors Sarah Waters and Helen Fielding, actors Dominic West and Olivia Colman, and industry figures Jane Tranter and Sue Birtwhistle

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the universe at the smallest scales, from tiny atoms to vast galaxies. The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred uncovers the construction techniques of stonemasons and carpenters through the ages, focusing on Norman cathedrals. The former steeplejack admires Peterborough Cathedral and Rochester Castle, where he demonstrates how tactics used to invade the fortress centuries ago resemble today's demolition methods

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the house's fortunes in the 18th and 19th centuries. He begins by investigating the death of owner Joseph Holbrook, and discovering why his daughter was written out of the will. A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg talks to John Wilson about the influences that shaped her career, including her earliest experiences of acting with a children's community project in New York, and being encouraged by her mother to make the most of free cultural opportunities in the city

programme.title: The Color Purple (1985)
programme.desc: A much-abused black woman is separated from her children and her sister, and doomed to a life of virtual slavery at the hands of her brutish new husband on an impoverished farm in rural Georgia. Steven Spielberg's drama, based on Alice Walker's novel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Danny Glover, Oprah Winfrey, Margaret Avery and Willard E Pugh

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture

David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Punt and Hugh Dennis present chart hits from October 6, 1994, in a selection of studio performances and videos from CJ Lewis, Cyndi Lauper, Madonna, Michelle Gayle, Bon Jovi, Elton John, Take That, Inxs and Whigfield. Plus, a vintage clip of the Stranglers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents music from October 13, 1994, by PJ & Duncan, Cappella, Gloria Estefan, Snap featuring Summer, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, Pato Banton, Two Thirds, Sting and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel presents the edition from May 27, featuring music by Debbie Harry, Genesis, Japan, Soft Cell, Duran Duran and Madness

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jensen presents an edition from May 24, 1979, with performances by the Skids, Roxy Music, ELO, Tubeway Army, Liner, the Damned, Dollar, David Bowie, the Shadows, Blondie and Elvis Costello and the Attractions

programme.title: Cilla at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable TV appearances by Cilla Black from the BBC archives. The much-missed performer began her presenting career in 1968 on the BBC, having already become one of Britain's most popular singers. The programme features her appearances on Not Only, But Also, The Ken Dodd Show, Top of the Pops and The Royal Variety Performance as well as her self-titled series, plus her famous 1973 duet with Marc Bolan

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt

programme.title: Dusty
programme.desc: Entertainment showcase with host Dusty Springfield and her backing band of Madeline Bell, Lesley Duncan and Maggie Stredder. With special guest Mel Torme. First aired in August 1967

programme.title: Lulu's Back in Town
programme.desc: Archive performances by the Scottish singer of songs including Trolley Song, Suddenly You Love Me and Lulu's Back in Town, accompanied by backing group the Ladybirds. Featuring the Everly Brothers, who perform Bye Bye Love, and a comedy routine by Les Dawson

programme.title: Sir Cliff Richard at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back through the BBC archives at some of the singer's most memorable performances and biggest hits. Amongst the classic songs featured are Move It, The Young Ones, Living Doll, Bachelor Boy, the Eurovision Song Contest contenders Congratulations and Power to All Our Friends, Devil Woman, Miss You Nights, Wired for Sound and Cliff's much-praised 1980s duet with Van Morrison, Wherever God Shines His Light

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun plays football with a cabbage that bounces into the field from a passing lorry - but the pigs try to spoil his fun

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: The Danger Agency realises that a lack of accounting has left them bankrupt. Whilst the bailiffs are in collecting goods from HQ the team decide to hold a telethon, asking people to phone in and donate funds. Revival of the classic cartoon about the adventures of a crimebusting rodent and his sidekick Penfold. With the voices of Alexander Armstrong and Kevin Eldon

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The gang find out that JJ has a set of pre-match good-luck rituals. In the run-up to an important Blamjitsu event, Walter deviously throws bad-luck omens into JJs path, threatening her chances of success.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
Newsround
programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: A genie gives the Ninjas three wishes in exchange for payment of his order

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: A villain sets off a backward bubble

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors try to trick their body temperatures, and Dr Xand tries to stop his body giving him away when he takes a lie detector test. Elsewhere, in Accident & Emergency one patient has mystery stomach pains and another has cut his leg on his bike

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall finds out which predators have the best weapons, looking at the adder, the diamond rattlesnake, the crocodile and the barn owl

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: The school boiler breaks meaning the heating won't come on. As the school gets colder and colder panic spreads, can the boiler be fixed or will everyone freeze?

programme.title: Big Fat Like
programme.desc: Log in for more sketch comedy with Richard David-Caine and Joseph Elliot. The Granny Gamer returns and there are high-risk stunts with The Try It Guy

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Horrible Histories charts the contribution of Black people to British life throughout history. How did African soldiers come to be guarding Hadrian's Wall? Why was a West African diver asked to help salvage Henry VIII's ship, the Mary Rose? And the actor Ira Aldridge tells us how he came to leave New York to find fame in 19th-century England.

programme.title: Bitesize: 9-11 Year Olds
programme.desc: Learn about how we use energy, renewable and non-renewable energy, and saving energy to save the planet.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors investigate how your body digests fat, and show you how to make bile art!

programme.title: Out of This World
programme.desc: In this episode, Dr Maggie takes us into space to study Earth and see how it has helped us to understand climate change. Dr Maggies star guest is Susanne Mecklenburg, who is in charge of analysing Earths climate at the European Space Agency. All your space questions are answered in Ask Maggie, and she counts down the top five surprising space facts.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and the flock are called into action to help track down an illusive pet rabbit - but they do not seem to understand exactly what they are looking for

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM and Penfold are in a training simulation when one of DM's flying kicks damages the holodeck with catastrophic consequences. The duop awake to find they have been in a three-year dream, that they aren't secret agents and work in IT instead, and the Danger Agency has been a figment of their imaginations. With the voices of Alexander Armstrong and Kevin Eldon

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Danger Mouse faces the Queen of Weevils in a fearful Halloween special

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Boy and Dog are working on their comedy act for a talent show

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: When the kids wonder about what they'll be when they grow up, Mouse's enhanced online career quiz leads Boy to think he is destined to be an astronaut, with Girl thinking she will end up a boring safety inspector. Both struggle to embrace their fates - but Mouse's science can't be wrong, can it?

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Walter's pampered cat Clawdia persuades her way into the gang, and only Gnasher can tell that she has a hidden agenda to oust him from Dennis's life for ever

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dr Pfooflepfeffer's first act as head of governors is to turn Bash Street School into a boarding school, but the pupils devise a series of daring attempts to escape

programme.title: Mustangs FC
programme.desc: The Mustangs need to get serious before the season officially starts, using the time for some unusual training methods, player recruitment and a big shake-up of their formation

programme.title: Mustangs FC
programme.desc: Marnie struggles to accept her new position in the team, while an injury forces Lara to face giving up dreams of gym glory

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: A-Troupe makes a decision that changes the lives of everyone at the studio.

programme.title: 4 O'Clock Club
programme.desc: Josh thinks he has written his best song and tries to sell CDs of it at school, until he realises he has sampled a famous track without receiving permission

programme.title: Nova Jones
programme.desc: Official music video for Be Strong by Nova Jones

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: While fighting over Viking treasure, the Nektons take over the Dark Orca. The pirates in turn take over the Aronnax. Neither side is happy about strangers in their homes, but neither is willing to back down

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Penfold's addiction to social media helps the Baron turn all of Danger Mouse's secrets against him in a plot to deflate the planet

Inside Nigels bag are a toy pig, a toy sheep and a toy chicken, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that are themed around things you might find at a farm. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate farm objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The fun song Old MacDonald Had A Farm features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring farm things too. programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monsters small kite doesnt seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben struggles to accept Lola's prognosis and accuses the family of accepting it too easily, after a heart to heart with Phil he starts to see the error in his ways. Tensions in the Slater household continue to rise and Freddie receives an ADHD referral. Plus, there is a glimmer of hope for Chelsea and Ravi's relationship

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A Gloucestershire woman brings in her King Charles II painting, hoping Lucia Scalisi can restore it to its crowning glory, and silversmith Brenton West works on a well-travelled trunk, which holds cherished memories for a mother and daughter. Goldsmith Richard Talman tries to reunite the broken pieces of an engagement ring and toy restorers Julie and Amanda revive a toy donkey that comforted a young child after he lost his mother and his sister

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Patrick Grant and Esme Young welcome 12 new sewers to the competition in Leeds. For their first pattern challenge, the sewers make a top with a twist at its centre to give them a straightforward construction task with an added brain teaser. In the transformation task the competitors take the traditional 'office uniform' of a pencil skirt and a blouse and make it reflect their own style. Finally in the made-to-measure challenge, the contestants try to perfectly fit a dress with cut-out details

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC Wales Live
programme.desc: Bethan Rhys Roberts presents the weekly show featuring stories and in-depth interviews about what is happening in Wales and why it matters

programme.title: You Don't Look...
programme.desc: Laura Gardner designs a special effects make-up look for Dafydd to help him visualise how living with depression feels for him

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: The daily reality for rookie nurses - especially in A&E - as they deal with life-and-death situations and everything in between. Twenty-two-year-old Mikey is part of the trauma team tasked with helping a teenage rugby player brought in by ambulance with severe concussion in Carmarthen. In Aberystwyth, 24-year-old nurse is Leah is unphased when a patient arrives having suffered a freak lawnmower accident which led to an amputation. Amid medical dramas on the wards, there's a big moment for health care assistant Caitlin who, after years of studying, is on her way to collect her new nurses uniform, and is excited to join her colleagues in her blues

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Mikey makes a decision that sends shockwaves through the masseria, and leaves many of the residents questioning the seriousness of each other's matches. Dannii Minogue gathers the boys for their first Chemistry Test to couples discover what brings them together and what moves them apart

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue shakes things up by welcoming three single men into the masseria, to see if some of the couples who have matched up are as devoted as they appear. While the new arrivals throw some serious moves at the party, Josh takes a break to reveal something important to Mikey before the boys all weigh up their options for the second Kiss-Off

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Tina Daheley present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon get to grips with the tricky problem of compostable and biodegradable packaging. Plus, the delivery companies letting down disabled customers

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: The impact that thefts and break-ins have on life in rural communities and how security systems that don't rely on a good internet connection are now helping to protect businesses in such areas. Presenter Rav Wilding also looks at how data captured by mobile phone masts helped bring a pair of prolific burglars to justice and how smart number plate recognition cameras can detect when a car is on false plates

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators examine the death of a worker at one of the UK's largest recycling plants. They seize more than 300 hours' worth of CCTV footage that shows dangerous work practices and breaches in health and safety in the days running up to the tragedy. Plus, efforts are made to catch a trader selling chocolate bars with a fake list of ingredients, putting children's health at risk

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the show from Shrewsbury, Shropshire, and visits RAF Cosford to learn about a team of Spitfire-flying women. With experts Thomas Forrester and Mark Stacey

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi's patient Jay takes a chance on a new relationship. However, things go from bad to worse. Medical drama set in a busy Midlands surgery, with Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, searching for three items with the potential to be revived. She saves a pine chest of drawers for carpenter Martin Hough and a trio of utility chairs for upcycler Sarah Peterson. Sarah takes on a set of trestle table bases for her own project

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A creative couple from London want to leave city life behind in search of new adventures in Gloucestershire, so Chris Bavin presents them with a selection of houses to guide them. Away from the search, Chris also visits a local football club which is green by name and green by nature

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Angellica Bell chats to YouTube and Strictly star Joe Sugg about his new-found passion for gardening and James Wong shares his beginners' guide to growing houseplants

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Sarah Readings presents a very well-loved and very well-travelled companion in need of help from soft toy experts Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell. This little doll of a sailor was named Fairstar after the ship he was bought on, and the ship that carried Sarah and her parents to Australia in the 1960s as 'Ten Pound Poms' - people encouraged to emigrate to Australia by the government with cheap fares. A mid-century camera and a child's musical chair are also rejuvenated

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay, Denise and Kim throw a ladies day party for Lola but Ben shows up to make a scene. Lily finally returns home but demands to leave school to avoid being bullied over Stacey's actions. Bobby convinces Freddie to meet with the ADHD specialist and Chelsea and Denise put their fallout behind them

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a 150,000 investment

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce is in Kent for the latest topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Gravesend to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Tina Daheley present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the food delivery giants making customers pay for items that were out of stock and never delivered. Plus, the issue of vouchers promised for holidays cancelled during the pandemic

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a pharmacy took a stand against shoplifters by creating a 'wall of shame' and the introduction of an innovative bodycam able to help shopkeepers identify prolific shoplifters and abusive customers. Plus, the work of a vehicle forensics expert following a ram raid on a jewellers in Leeds. Presented by Rav Wilding

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators confront firms bombarding elderly people with marketing phone calls and pressuring them into taking out insurance policies and setting up direct debits. They also confront a travel agent with a shop full of angry customers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is surprised to discover the high expense involved in buying a patch of grass in London, before heading off to Greater Manchester to look at a tenanted, terraced property that leaves a lot to be desired. Meanwhile, Martel Maxwell visits Cumbria to look round a two-bed semi with an interesting roof

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts as two teams of antiques enthusiasts battle it out in Doune, Perthshire, under the guidance of experts Roo Irvine and Danny Sebastian. Natasha also meets leading tartan historian Peter MacDonald to learn about the origins of the iconic patterned cloth

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Callum has told Finn that Al is a corrupt cop. Al manages to convince Finn that Callum is mistaken, but things go from bad to worse when Jake McGrade assaults a security guard and steals a million pounds worth of whiskey from the Port Devine distillery. Siobhan is worried that Finn is moving too fast to prove that he's nothing like his father, but Concepta drops a massive bombshell to prove otherwise

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and designer Lucy Tiffney upcycle a pair of old lamps and a tired display cabinet at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: An Essex couple seekJonnie Irwin's help to find a home in North Yorkshire. Jonnie also visits the popular seaside resort of Whitby on a mission to work out why people love fish and chips so much and to discover who makes the best in town

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Morning Live presenter Gethin Jones shares his passion for gardening and Toby Buckland shares ideas on how to create a show-stopping moment in our gardens ahead of the start of summer. Presented by Angellica Bell and Nicki Chapman

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vanessa Simonite with what appears to be a piece of wood and a bag of bits, but which once was a beautiful mosaic table made by hand by her late husband. On hand to help repair this ultimate jigsaw puzzle is the barn's ceramic expert Kirsten Ramsay with help from woodwork whizz Will Kirk. A well-loved family recipe book and an art deco clock also receive much-needed restorations

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: On the eve of its final day, Sophie Raworth and Joe Swift reveal the winner of the BBC RHS People's Choice Award. Mary Berry asks the pavilion growers how best to create a stunning floral cutting garden, Adam Frost and Toby Buckland review the top planting trends that have emerged at this year's show, while Frances Tophill showcases the cocktails that can be made using botanicals and herbs grown at home

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Celebrated tenor and Radio Wales presenter Wynne Evans explores the BBC Wales archives of 1973. Highlights include Dr Who at a local mine, the steam train up Yr Wyddfa and the opening of a new hotel for dogs. With music from Geraint Evans and comedy duo Ryan and Ronnie. Plus, Dave Edmonds demonstrates his recording techniques at Rockfield

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Imaginations run wild in this semi-final as the contestants' latest brief is to cook a dish both 'theatrical and fantastical' in nature. The hopefuls need to create a dish that pushes boundaries, playing with both mind and senses. Later, judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace have to determine who warrants contesting Finals Week

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Steph McGovern hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with broadcaster Carol Vorderman and comedian Nabil Abdulrashid joining Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of the news

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Dom and Kay get in touch with a woman known as Thirsty Kirsty via a dating app on Clinton's phone, hoping she can help extract them from the mess they are in. They arrange to meet the mysterious contact they suspect is also operating undercover as they set about investigating the seemingly shady Superintendent Edwards by breaking into her office. Meanwhile, a revelation from PCSO Pricey causes Dom to believe that Clinton may not have been what he seemed. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker and Katherine Kelly

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie hilariously poke fun at life with celebrity guests. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Madison and Oly attend a protest rampage, dragging a nervous Michael along for the ride. Oly's hangover leads to a big parenting fail, while a confusing encounter between Jacinda and Santi's new girlfriend distracts her away from Reema's return from London. Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Photograph (2020)
programme.desc: Michael, a reporter, becomes fascinated by a picture of a woman, and wants to know her backstory. In the present day, following the death of her estranged mother, a devastated young woman finds a photo that will change her life forever. Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the food delivery giants making customers pay for items that were out of stock and never delivered. Plus, the issue of vouchers promised for holidays cancelled during the pandemic

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a pharmacy took a stand against shoplifters by creating a 'wall of shame' and the introduction of an innovative bodycam able to help shopkeepers identify prolific shoplifters and abusive customers. Plus, the work of a vehicle forensics expert following a ram raid on a jewellers in Leeds. Presented by Rav Wilding

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators confront firms bombarding elderly people with marketing phone calls and pressuring them into taking out insurance policies and setting up direct debits. They also confront a travel agent with a shop full of angry customers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts as two teams of antiques enthusiasts battle it out in Doune, Perthshire, under the guidance of experts Roo Irvine and Danny Sebastian. Natasha also meets leading tartan historian Peter MacDonald to learn about the origins of the iconic patterned cloth

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Callum has told Finn that Al is a corrupt cop. Al manages to convince Finn that Callum is mistaken, but things go from bad to worse when Jake McGrade assaults a security guard and steals a million pounds worth of whiskey from the Port Devine distillery. Siobhan is worried that Finn is moving too fast to prove that he's nothing like his father, but Concepta drops a massive bombshell to prove otherwise

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and designer Lucy Tiffney upcycle a pair of old lamps and a tired display cabinet at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: An Essex couple seekJonnie Irwin's help to find a home in North Yorkshire. Jonnie also visits the popular seaside resort of Whitby on a mission to work out why people love fish and chips so much and to discover who makes the best in town

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Morning Live presenter Gethin Jones shares his passion for gardening and Toby Buckland shares ideas on how to create a show-stopping moment in our gardens ahead of the start of summer. Presented by Angellica Bell and Nicki Chapman

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vanessa Simonite with what appears to be a piece of wood and a bag of bits, but which once was a beautiful mosaic table made by hand by her late husband. On hand to help repair this ultimate jigsaw puzzle is the barn's ceramic expert Kirsten Ramsay with help from woodwork whizz Will Kirk. A well-loved family recipe book and an art deco clock also receive much-needed restorations

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: On the eve of its final day, Sophie Raworth and Joe Swift reveal the winner of the BBC RHS People's Choice Award. Mary Berry asks the pavilion growers how best to create a stunning floral cutting garden, Adam Frost and Toby Buckland review the top planting trends that have emerged at this year's show, while Frances Tophill showcases the cocktails that can be made using botanicals and herbs grown at home

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits Tweed Forest Park in the Borders, where he finds out how it is being future-proofed against climate change and extreme weather events. Arlene Stuart visits dairy cattle near Dumfries that are being studied to assess how 'happy' they are, while Cammy Wilson meets a couple who have developed their own environmentally friendly, organic chicken feed. Anne Lundon is on the banks of the River Tay working her way through the biggest reed beds in the country and hearing how they benefit both people and nature

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Imaginations run wild in this semi-final as the contestants' latest brief is to cook a dish both 'theatrical and fantastical' in nature. The hopefuls need to create a dish that pushes boundaries, playing with both mind and senses. Later, judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace have to determine who warrants contesting Finals Week

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Steph McGovern hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with broadcaster Carol Vorderman and comedian Nabil Abdulrashid joining Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of the news

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Dom and Kay get in touch with a woman known as Thirsty Kirsty via a dating app on Clinton's phone, hoping she can help extract them from the mess they are in. They arrange to meet the mysterious contact they suspect is also operating undercover as they set about investigating the seemingly shady Superintendent Edwards by breaking into her office. Meanwhile, a revelation from PCSO Pricey causes Dom to believe that Clinton may not have been what he seemed. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker and Katherine Kelly

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie hilariously poke fun at life with celebrity guests. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Brentford defender Ethan Pinnock, Olympic hockey champion Hollie Pearne-Webb, world indoor 60m title-winner Richard Kilty and European gold medal-winning diver Tonia Couch join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Madison and Oly attend a protest rampage, dragging a nervous Michael along for the ride. Oly's hangover leads to a big parenting fail, while a confusing encounter between Jacinda and Santi's new girlfriend distracts her away from Reema's return from London. Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Photograph (2020)
programme.desc: Michael, a reporter, becomes fascinated by a picture of a woman, and wants to know her backstory. In the present day, following the death of her estranged mother, a devastated young woman finds a photo that will change her life forever. Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

programme.title: Rip Off Britain

programme.title: Frontline Fightback

programme.title: Defenders UK

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey where she finds an Edwardian armchair, a dated display cabinet and a collection of costume jewellery for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor meets a pregnant couple who are returning to the UK after seven years in Switzerland and looking for a family home in Cambridgeshire. programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
