programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The sights and sounds of the famous horticultural event

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben struggles to accept Lola's prognosis and accuses the family of accepting it too easily, after a heart to heart with Phil he starts to see the error in his ways. Tensions in the Slater household continue to rise and Freddie receives an ADHD referral. Plus, there is a glimmer of hope for Chelsea and Ravi's relationship

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A Gloucestershire woman brings in her King Charles II painting, hoping Lucia Scalisi can restore it to its crowning glory, and silversmith Brenton West works on a well-travelled trunk, which holds cherished memories for a mother and daughter. Goldsmith Richard Talman tries to reunite the broken pieces of an engagement ring and toy restorers Julie and Amanda revive a toy donkey that comforted a young child after he lost his mother and his sister

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Patrick Grant and Esme Young welcome 12 new sewers to the competition in Leeds. For their first pattern challenge, the sewers make a top with a twist at its centre to give them a straightforward construction task with an added brain teaser. In the transformation task the competitors take the traditional 'office uniform' of a pencil skirt and a blouse and make it reflect their own style. Finally in the made-to-measure challenge, the contestants try to perfectly fit a dress with cut-out details

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Mikey makes a decision that sends shockwaves through the masseria, and leaves many of the residents questioning the seriousness of each other's matches. Dannii Minogue gathers the boys for their first Chemistry Test to couples discover what brings them together and what moves them apart

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue shakes things up by welcoming three single men into the masseria, to see if some of the couples who have matched up are as devoted as they appear. While the new arrivals throw some serious moves at the party, Josh takes a break to reveal something important to Mikey before the boys all weigh up their options for the second Kiss-Off

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Tina Daheley present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon get to grips with the tricky problem of compostable and biodegradable packaging. Plus, the delivery companies letting down disabled customers

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: The impact that thefts and break-ins have on life in rural communities and how security systems that don't rely on a good internet connection are now helping to protect businesses in such areas. Presenter Rav Wilding also looks at how data captured by mobile phone masts helped bring a pair of prolific burglars to justice and how smart number plate recognition cameras can detect when a car is on false plates

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators examine the death of a worker at one of the UK's largest recycling plants. They seize more than 300 hours' worth of CCTV footage that shows dangerous work practices and breaches in health and safety in the days running up to the tragedy. Plus, efforts are made to catch a trader selling chocolate bars with a fake list of ingredients, putting children's health at risk

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the show from Shrewsbury, Shropshire, and visits RAF Cosford to learn about a team of Spitfire-flying women. With experts Thomas Forrester and Mark Stacey

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi's patient Jay takes a chance on a new relationship. However, things go from bad to worse. Medical drama set in a busy Midlands surgery, with Adrian Lewis Morgan

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, searching for three items with the potential to be revived. She saves a pine chest of drawers for carpenter Martin Hough and a trio of utility chairs for upcycler Sarah Peterson. Sarah takes on a set of trestle table bases for her own project

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A creative couple from London want to leave city life behind in search of new adventures in Gloucestershire, so Chris Bavin presents them with a selection of houses to guide them. Away from the search, Chris also visits a local football club which is green by name and green by nature

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Angellica Bell chats to YouTube and Strictly star Joe Sugg about his new-found passion for gardening and James Wong shares his beginners' guide to growing houseplants

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Sarah Readings presents a very well-loved and very well-travelled companion in need of help from soft toy experts Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell. This little doll of a sailor was named Fairstar after the ship he was bought on, and the ship that carried Sarah and her parents to Australia in the 1960s as 'Ten Pound Poms' - people encouraged to emigrate to Australia by the government with cheap fares. A mid-century camera and a child's musical chair are also rejuvenated

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay, Denise and Kim throw a ladies day party for Lola but Ben shows up to make a scene. Lily finally returns home but demands to leave school to avoid being bullied over Stacey's actions. Bobby convinces Freddie to meet with the ADHD specialist and Chelsea and Denise put their fallout behind them

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a 150,000 investment

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Actors Larry Lamb and Alison Steadman embark on a road trip to investigate their respective family histories using a mix of DNA and genealogy, meeting living family members they never knew existed along the way. Alison comes to learn that her father George Percy was adopted. For Larry, a series of delightful coincidences occur. There's the entertaining bombshell that he's related to one of the world's first famous movie stars, a Canadian actress called Florence Lawrence. A pure coincidence, but Canada is the place where Larry started his acting career himself. He also finds out where his Jewish roots come from, all the way from Lithuania which just happens to be where his best mate hails from

programme.desc: Three singletons in Essex try to win the affections of podium dancer Ciara by picking an outfit of their choice for her to wear

programme.desc: Mouth has trouble finding a story as he reports on the Ravens' first basketball game of the season. Tensions mount when Haley, Brooke, Peyton, Lindsey and Mia are locked in the library, while Lucas and Nathan decide whether to tell their partners about their indiscretions

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Rumours of Pacey's affair with Tamara spread around the school, while Bessie gives birth in Dawson's living room - with the help of Jen's grandmother, who is forced to act as impromptu midwife. Katie Holmes, Joshua Jackson and Nina Repeta star

programme.desc: Tyler reveals his feelings to Tay, but their family connections might stand in the way of true love, while Emilia wants Luke for more than just a party

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Three single men in Cardiff try to win the affection of Ben Brown - also known as Mr Gay Wales 2017 - by each buying their potential date an outfit they think he might like

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, former Emmerdale star Gemma Oaten chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again

programme.desc: The family of TV presenter Rachel Riley and her husband and former Strictly star Pasha Kovalev take on the family of footballing veteran Chris Kamara for a chance to win a 30,000 jackpot prize for their chosen charities. Gino D'Acampo hosts

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The reluctant secret agent tracks down his long-lost father and gets a job working with one of his idols, business magnate Ted Roark. Meanwhile, Lester and Jeff convince Mike they should attend NextExpo. Chevy Chase and Scott Bakula guest star

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Brooke is confronted by a ghost from her past when she takes Owen to New York, so he can experience the other side of her life. Nathan and Lucas attend Dan's parole hearing, while a record label takes an interest in Peyton's artist. Chad Michael Murray and James Lafferty star

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: The frustration of being stuck in detention on a Saturday morning proves too much for Dawson and his friends. Frustrated, they begin taking out their anger on each other in a series of tense exchanges. Teenage drama, starring James Van Der Beek, Katie Holmes and Michelle Williams

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Matchmaking show in which people hope to connect through their love of food. In this episode, The Real Housewives of Cheshire's Ester Dee chooses three blind dates based entirely on menus created by five potential partners

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a charity edition of the game show, with three famous faces all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a 50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The superstore plays host to local small businesses, including Glenn's wife who has come to sell her hand-made needlepoint - leading to accusations of favouritism

Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele and Deon Stewardson

programme.desc: Greengrass embarks on yet another new career, this time trying to earn a crust as a racehorse trainer after a suspicious death at a local stables leaves a window of opportunity. programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: As Foyle and his team search for a missing boy, their investigation leads them to a less than inviting hotel - and the discovery of the youngster's body in the nearby woods suggests one of the residents could be responsible. Milner finds his loyalty divided when Foyle is placed under house arrest, but the determined investigator vows to prove his innocence. Drama series, starring Michael Kitchen

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A criminal's wife commits suicide, making Mike wish he had not been quite so forceful in extracting a confession. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress's determination to protect a widow's home from a gang of louts becomes an all-consuming obsession, while Greengrass gets his fingers burnt attempting to break into the fish and chip industry, little realising what a competitive business it is. Rural drama, starring William Simons and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway appears to have got over his fear of Lewis treading over his newly promoted toes. Their opposites have attracted in the past, and there seems no reason to suspect that they won't now the younger man has got used to the idea of his former mentor coming out of retirement to lend him a hand. Even DS Maddox isn't getting on Hathaway's nerves quite as much, so this rejuvenated trio sets out to discover who murdered American classics student Rose Anderson, whose body has been hauled from the canal with neck and abdomen wounds. Nevertheless, a few red herrings threaten to get in their way of landing the killer. Kevin Whately, Laurence Fox and Angela Griffin star

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Tony becomes absorbed in a bizarre chain of murders in which each perpetrator in turn becomes the next victim, but the unusual modus operandi of beating, strangulation and shooting - always with the same gun - remains the same. Completely caught up in the case, he fails to pick up dark hints from cannibal Michael, whom he helped to convict, that he is planning to escape from the secure unit where he is held. Thriller, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby and the Gang are in Sicily they're chasing a fire monster! But they are surprised to meet up with none other than famous actor Steve Buscemi. His ancestors are from this area and he has a lot of cousins in town and was just visiting. But he's being plagued by fire monster attacks. programme.desc: A documentary film-maker visits Springfield to see how the town's residents are progressing, making Homer worry he will not be seen as a success. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. Plus, 19-year-old cyclist Mack requires specialist help for a dislocated shoulder, after he collided with a Porsche. His dad explains how adopting him and his brother changed all of their lives

programme.title: Taskmaster

It's nearly the end of the series, and the pressure is so intense that Mae immediately forgets the only rule to a task. Greg demands to be educated about history - but the five comics only seem to know about the year 1066. And there's paint, stomping, poor time-keeping and some impressively sneaky prizes in this quazi semi-final. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Natalie and Tom from Yorkshire arrive at the retreat wanting to spice up their 12-year relationship. Their mismatched sexual histories mean that Natalie arrives with a confidence that Tom might be unable to match. After a flirtatious evening leads to steamy intimacy in the hot tub with residents Josh and Holly, the couple are left questioning everything. Meanwhile, Chanice and Richardo invite 15 of the residents upstairs for an orgy, though being in a room with so many people having sex proves overwhelming for Richardo, so a once-in-a-lifetime experience seems set to pass the couple by

programme.title: Naked Attraction

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays

Next up in the Algarve, Portugal, is the 180,000-a-week Vila Azzurine, where billionaires retreat to when they are looking for some sun and sea, before embarking on a 16,000-a-night ultra-lux safari adventure at the Royal Malewane in South Africa's Kruger National Park. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi

In the water surrounded city of Kandy, Alexander is introduced to Sri Lanka's ancient traditional medicine, Ayurveda, before visiting a rural jungle retreat where he finds himself at the mercy of Dr DeSilva who treats him to an array of traditional Ayurvedic treatments. Later, Alexander heads south towards Udawalawe National Park to the baby Elephant Transit Home, a rehabilitation centre for young orphaned elephants, and finds out more about how humans and elephants co-exist on the island

programme.title: Ken Dodd: 60 Years of Laughter
programme.desc: A celebration of the comedian, who was embraced by the emerging TV age, while always keeping alive the old-school comedy of the music hall. Through his amazing routines, interviews and one-liners, the programme examines the career of this student of comedy, who was also a highly successful recording artist. With contributions by friends, colleagues and fans from down the years, including Anita Harris, Roger McGough, Ricky Tomlinson and David Morrissey

programme.title: True Lies (1994)
programme.desc: A seemingly ordinary computer salesman leads a double life as a secret agent battling international terrorism. His naive wife is unaware of his dual employment, and goes in search of adventure - only to end up in the clutches of terrorists who have stolen a nuclear weapon. James Cameron's action comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jamie Lee Curtis and Tom Arnold

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Examining the execution of German spies captured in the two world wars. There's a profile of suffragette Leonora Cohen, who took aim at the crown jewels to publicise her cause. There's a look back to 2014, when the Tower hosted a display of nearly 900,000 ceramic poppies in the moat for Remembrance Day. In the Royal Armouries after dark, curator Bridget examines a telling reminder of the horrors of war. Plus, another new recruit joins the Beefeaters

programme.title: OMG
programme.desc: Men who are determined to achieve their ideal of male beauty. A Merseyside resident is considering penis enlargement surgery, a pop star hopes to further his career by developing the perfect body, a stripper hopes to gain more attention on social media, and a Manchester man has had collagen injections in his lips

programme.desc: Pip tries to keep a secret

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: A Bollywood action movie is being filmed on the Indian railway and Thomas is desperate to be involved

programme.title: Timberjack (1954)
programme.desc: A man forced to return to his Montana home to take over the family lumber business sets out to discover the reasons behind his father's death, while engaging in a fierce professional and romantic rivalry with a neighbouring forester. Western, starring Sterling Hayden, David Brian, Vera Ralston and Hoagy Carmichael

programme.title: To Hell and Back (1955)
programme.desc: Biopic of actor Audie Murphy, following his service in the Second World War. Enlisting in the Army as a teenager to support his younger siblings, he excelled himself in action in the conflict in Europe and became one of America's most decorated soldiers. Starring Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson, Charles Drake and Gregg Palmer

programme.title: Tomahawk (1951)
programme.desc: Frontier scout Jim Bridger doesn't approve when a gold rush leads the US army to build a fort on land occupied by the Sioux. The situation goes from bad to worse when a sadistic officer launches an unprovoked attack, prompting a vengeful tribe to go on the offensive and leaving Bridger the only one who can save the soldiers at the fort from certain death. Western, starring Van Heflin, Yvonne de Carlo and Alex Nicol, and featuring an early appearance by Rock Hudson

programme.title: High Noon (1952)
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness (2013)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and the crew of the starship Enterprise are sent on a clandestine mission into enemy territory to track down the rogue Starfleet agent behind a terrorist attack on Earth. However, the assignment brings to light a hidden threat from within their own organisation. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: Men in Black (1997)
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: Fight Club (1999)
programme.desc: A disillusioned office worker grows weary of his humdrum existence, but after meeting the mysterious Tyler Durden he finds fulfilment in establishing a club where similarly frustrated men come to vent their anger in bouts of bare-knuckle fighting. Satirical drama, directed by David Fincher, starring Edward Norton, Brad Pitt, Helena Bonham Carter, Meat Loaf and Jared Leto

programme.title: American Gigolo (1980)
programme.desc: A male escort is falsely accused of murdering a wealthy woman, and his only hope of proving his innocence rests with a client reluctant to come forward and provide him with an alibi. Thriller, written and directed by Paul Schrader, starring Richard Gere, Lauren Hutton and Hector Elizondo

programme.title: The Running Man (1963)
programme.desc: A pilot with a chip on his shoulder sets out to take revenge on a money-grubbing insurance company by faking his own death and moving to Spain on the payout. However, just when everything seems to be going swimmingly, an investigator turns up unannounced. Drama, starring Laurence Harvey, Lee Remick and Alan Bates

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

programme.title: Hatari! (1962)
programme.desc: A group of reckless animal trappers travels through the wilds of Africa, but the arrival of a beautiful photographer looks set to cause upheaval among the group. Comedy adventure, starring John Wayne, Red Buttons, Hardy Kruger, Elsa Martinelli and Michele Girardon

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: Men in Black II (2002)
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Shallow Grave (1994)
programme.desc: Three flat-sharing friends rent out their spare room to an enigmatic stranger, who promptly dies of an overdose, leaving behind a suitcase crammed full of cash. They plot to dispose of the body and keep the money - but as a curious detective comes looking for the dead man, the flatmates turn on one another. Danny Boyle's thriller, starring Ewan McGregor, Christopher Eccleston and Kerry Fox

programme.title: Onoda: 10,000 Nights in the Jungle (2021)
programme.desc: A Japanese soldier refuses to believe World War II has ended and continues to fight on a remote Philippine island until 1974. Drama, inspired by Bernard Cendron and Gerard Chenu's 1974 biography Onoda: Seul en guerre dans la jungle, and starring Yuya Endo

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat (1957)
programme.desc: A lieutenant deserts after his commanding officer launches an unprovoked attack on a Comanche village during the Civil War. Realising that there are no soldiers in his home town to protect it from reprisals, he returns to train the local women to defend themselves. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Kathryn Grant, Hope Emerson and Jeff Donnell

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora! (1970)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards

programme.title: The Red Pony (1949)
programme.desc: A boy seeks solace from his feuding family through his friendships with his beloved pony and a ranch hand, whom he idolises. When the animal dies his relationship with his father seems to be damaged irreparably. Drama based on a short story by John Steinbeck, starring Robert Mitchum, Myrna Loy and Peter Miles

programme.title: A Lawless Street (1955)
programme.desc: A long-serving marshal, who has done his utmost to the keep peace in the town of Medicine Bend, looks forward to a reconciliation with his estranged wife, a touring musical star. Just as she arrives in town, three notorious criminals show up and start causing trouble - and the lawman has to decide whether to hang up his guns for his wife's sake or do his duty. Western, with Randolph Scott, Angela Lansbury, Jean Parker and Warner Anderson

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2 (2017)
programme.desc: Having settled their differences, Brad and Dusty's newfound friendship is put to the test when their respective fathers - one gentle, the other overly macho - arrive for the Christmas holidays, forcing them to change their plans. What starts as a break at a fun-filled trip to a luxury resort turns into something far more chaotic. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow

programme.title: Men in Black 3 (2012)
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears (2002)
programme.desc: The CIA becomes suspicious of Russia's nuclear activities, and agent Jack Ryan is ordered to investigate. However, it is not long before the threat of terrorists detonating a nuclear bomb on American soil is on the cards, sparking a race against the clock to avert disaster. Thriller based on Tom Clancy's novel, starring Ben Affleck, Morgan Freeman, James Cromwell, Liev Schreiber, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Bates

programme.title: Freaks (2019)
programme.desc: A girl discovers a mysterious new world beyond her front door after she escapes her father's protective and paranoid control. Sci-fi mystery, starring Emile Hirsch, Bruce Dern, Grace Park and Lexy Kolker

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: At the youth centre, Felix is on the receiving end of a warning. Meanwhile, the walls start to close in on Charlie when he finds himself under ever more pressure

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Mike & Nellie's Steakhouse in Oakhurst, New Jersey, where owner Mike Farber is mourning his father Nellie, who was also his business partner. Having been called in by the restaurateur's two daughters, Gordon faces the task of getting him to focus on his business, before tackling the bigger problem of rotting decor and a less-than-appealing menu

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay travels to the El Greco restaurant in Austin, Texas, where the owners have resorted to using a microwave to prepare their 'authentic' Greek dishes. Gordon faces the difficult task of uniting a squabbling family before tackling the bigger problem of a business on the brink of collapse

programme.desc: Jeffords believes the Pontiac Bandit is up to his old tricks and stealing cars again, but Peralta is convinced he's wrong and attempts to prove it. The rest of the squad battles to keep Shaw's bar a police hangout after some firefighters stake their claim to it

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.desc: Leonard turns to Penny for advice when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he would have liked, and he realises he is the last person to notice that she has moved in with him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette annoys his friends as Christmas approaches. Meanwhile, Leonard is thrilled to meet an award-winning scientist, only to be filled with jealousy when his new colleague takes an interest in Penny. With guest star Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica, One Tree Hill)

programme.desc: Cam is determined to lead the Dolphins to victory in a big football game, showing no mercy to the opposition despite the fact they are playing with an unexpected disadvantage. Meanwhile, at Pritchett Closets & Blinds, Claire is desperate to prove to her colleagues that she is more than just the boss's daughter. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire for the third day of the competition, where first impressions of Ray Chowdhury's unique style and decor are positive. However, room inspections leave Jane and Keith Smith threatening not to stay, and the guests grill their host about his business background at dinner. Although some light relief is given in the form of ice sculpting, breakfast disappoints James and Darren Kosa-Jones, and Ray must face the harsh reality of his guests' opinions at feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to Donna and David's Silverton B&B in Shrewsbury, where the complimentary earplugs soon have Darren and James worrying about the noise from the road outside. A Segway race helps whip up the guests' competitive spirit, Donna gets emotional when her work-life balance is questioned, and chef David proves he can handle the unexpected at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner announced. Swallows Rest is first up and hosts Jane and Keith want to find out about Ray's colour preferences. Next Darren and James of the Burley Inn quiz Ray over his fussiness around their pine furniture. When it comes to the Silverton, B&B team Donna and David take umbrage with Jane and Keith's comments

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY

Familiar faces Edward and Anna return. With Anna six months pregnant, they face an uphill battle to get everything finished before the arrival of their first wedding party of the season

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Stephen Yeoman and Anita Findlay, who want to build a cutting-edge, post-industrial house covered in rusty metal. However, their prominent riverside plot in the traditional and architecturally conservative area of South Downs means everyone will be watching. The project proves to be a real rollercoaster when the fitting of the rusty steel cladding goes wrong, cash flow problems threaten to bring work to a halt, and the couple announce that a baby is on the way

programme.title: Hitler: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: The public and private life of the infamous dictator, featuring the photos and videos of two photographers who dedicated their lives to documenting Hitler - Heinrich Hoffmann, his official photographer, and Hoffmann's photographic assistant Eva Braun, who went on to become Hitler's wife. The archive footage includes 1,300 recently digitised, rarely seen photos taken by Hoffmann and material garnered from Eva's personal photo collection, along with more than four hours of her home videos - mostly filmed at Hitler's fortified chalet in the Bavarian Alps

programme.title: Caught on Camera

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Jerry currently works for the ambulance service, but is retiring in a few years, so now is the perfect time for them to purchase a holiday home together in Brittany in France. As Jerry's busy with work, Julie will be searching for a property with her best friend Lindy. programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Surrey, where they visit a collector of Kawasaki motorbikes

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A company is contacted by a man who is trying to track down the rest of his family after his cousin dies, and the beneficiaries of a Roman Catholic priest's will embark on a journey to learn about his remarkable dedication to his Manchester parish. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the King's Head in Addlethorpe, Lincolnshire, where landlady Helen Coy and her bar manager and best friend Emma Green are pulling out all the stops to win. The B&B owners are taken back to their childhood at the funfair, At dinner, B&B beginners Louise and Andy Macbeth rattle nerves when Louise reveals her past career as a hospitality journalist - leaving pub veteran Helen less than impressed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B newcomers Andy and Louise Macbeth invite their rival hoteliers to spend the night at the dog-friendly Beck Hall in North Yorkshire, where an extra-critical Helen and Emma discover what they believe to be stray dog hairs in their bed. A fishing trip makes Terri feel a little out of sorts, and when the time arrives for feedback, the managers are surprised to learn two of their guests have indicated they would not come back for a second stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Albaston in Torquay for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed by owners and avid souvenir collectors, Kevin and Julie Shadbolt. Terri and Stuart are impressed by their room, but are startled by the memorabilia in the communal lounge, and expectations are raised at dinner when Kevin reveals he has a secret recipe for success when it comes to breakfast. However, at feedback the next day, tensions begin to rise

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay of the week is in Bournemouth, at Terri and Stewart's specialist dance holiday venue the Hotel Piccadilly, where a class in the grand ballroom soon has the guests in a spin. However, temperatures rise over dinner when the simmering tension between Louise and Helen finally boils over

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet up for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Six weeks into their new life as chateau owners, Donna and Paul start transforming their abandoned scullery into an all-singing, all-dancing kitchen. However, they have to down tools when they discover thousands of dead bees in a chimney. Clouds gather over Anna and Edward's chateau, but their first bride of the season remains eager for an al-fresco ceremony regardless of the weather. Meanwhile, Adam's chateau-buying quest heads south

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Identical twins Nik and Jon Daughtry build two near-identical houses next door to each other in Sheffield, paying tribute to the city's industrial past. Their plans are incredibly ambitious, not only do they want to build the two houses for the price of one, but the materials and finish have to be absolutely perfect. With a tight budget, it's an almighty stretch from the start. As delays, overages and imperfections hit, it's clear the twins' intuitive and incredibly close relationship will be tested like never before

programme.title: Great British Dog Walks with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: The property guru takes to the countryside alongside the newest addition to his family, German short-haired pointer puppy Luna, where he catches up with some celebrity friends. In this episode, Phil is joined by SAS hero Billy Billingham - the lead instructor on SAS: Who Dares Wins - and his bulldog Alfie. Phil learns about Billy's inspirational life story as they walk, from knife fights on the streets of Walsall to serving his country on battlefields across the globe in the world's finest special forces unit. Billy shares insights into his extraordinary career and introduces Phil to the philosophy that helps him always go a little further

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations

How will they cope cooped up in a caravan on-site with the children while they oversee the renovation?

During a visit to a local vineyard, sparks fly between Mike Hepker and Tash Thorne, who runs The Old Lodge Hotel in Gosport with her partner Mike Pearce. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef heads to Berlin, where history and the avant garde dwell side by side. A city that once made history with its divisive wall and Checkpoint Charlie now teems with an overwhelming array of innovative chefs offering delicious seasonal creations, such as pureed sunflower seeds, Jerusalem artichoke flans and crushed frozen pine nuts. Loved by the likes of Greta Garbo, Charlie Chaplin and Auguste Escoffier there's still a cornucopia of choice for those with a more traditional temperament with eisbein, meatballs and sausages topping every menu in the German capital

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey through north-west England, Michael Portillo makes a clean sweep in Ashley, Cheshire, where in Victorian times the new middle classes set up home in suburban villas with multiple chimneys swept by children. In Macclesfield, he finds the end of the Silk Route and tries his hand at screen printing. Then after stoking the fire on the steam-powered Churnet Valley Railway, the former politician alights at Froghall, Staffordshire, heading for Alton Towers to trace the 19th-century origins of the theme park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new railway journey along the south coast of England. Beginning in the port of Dover, he takes a plunge into the English Channel, inspired by the example set by a brave 19th-century sea captain. A miniature steam train one third the size of a conventional locomotive conveys him from Romney Marsh to Dungeness, and in Eastbourne, he learns how the 7th Duke of Devonshire managed to market the town's attractions to the refined upper-crust of Victorian London. The first leg of his trip concludes in eccentric style at the Glyndebourne opera festival on the South Downs

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack's journey takes him to the North East, where he visits a pumping station that ran for 100 years before ceasing operation in 1967 and travels across the Middlesbrough Transporter Bridge. He also discovers a company in Bradford which still makes boilers in the old-fashioned way, with rivets instead of welding

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Newhaven to Worthing, examining the nation's hidden defences, and taking in two magnificent engineering achievements - the Ouse Valley Viaduct and the Clayton Tunnel. High on top of a favourite Victorian beauty spot he learns how trains carried hordes of day-trippers to fly kites, and finds a novel way to pick tomatoes in Worthing

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Littlehampton, where he discovers how Victorian engineers defended the town's residents from cholera. In the New Forest, the presenter visits Florence Nightingale's family home, before finishing at Beaulieu, where he seizes the opportunity to drive the first motor car

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britain's finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. Viking attacks caused the monks to flee but the village survived and today the community has to share it with thousands of tourists

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack investigates traditional craftsmanship in Yorkshire and Derbyshire, including glass-cutting, making rivets using the traditional hot forge method, and ornate carving. He also catches up with some old friends in the process of restoring a showman's engine and watches workers at the Midland Railway Centre as they repair damaged trains

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins his latest journey in the sailing town of Lymington, where he makes a life-saving discovery. The route takes him through the Dorchester countryside, where he discovers how the introduction of the railway inspired Thomas Hardy. He tries his hand at carpet-making in Axminster and concludes his journey in Exmouth, where he learns about the work of forgotten Victorian landscape artist Francis Danby

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Plymouth, Michael Portillo finds out about the Royal Navy's fighting spirit and mixes his own blend of 'ruin'. Then, crossing into Cornwall, he learns about the last bridge to be built by renowned engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel. By Tre, Pol and Pen, the ex-politician comes to know Cornishmen and how to prepare the perfect pasty. This leg of his journey ends in a small village, which in Victorian times became a hub of global communications

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Clovelly in Devon, looking at its transformation from fishing harbour to romantic Victorian seaside resort. Thanks to a powerful and pioneering woman, Clovelly found itself at the forefront of the holiday revolution, and even today cars are banned and the village is privately owned, helping to preserve it as a reminder of a bygone age

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: A look at the North Yorkshire Moors Railway, following the lives of some of the workers who keep the wheels turning and the passengers happy on one of the world's most popular steam lines. To pull in the punters in, star engine Royal Scot is hired to headline for a week and for general manager Chris it's an expensive gamble as this big and powerful engine was designed to thunder on mainline rails, while the heritage railway has much smaller platforms and bridges. Until Royal Scot arrives and goes through a gauging run on the line, they won't know if she will actually fit the railway

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his great American trek, following his copy of Appleton's General Guide east from Manhattan to Long Island, and visits Brooklyn to hear the story of the construction of the world's first suspension bridge. Below ground, he investigates New York City's inaugural subway, and the dangers faced by the 'sandhogs' who built it. Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of America's richest men. Later, he heads to the island's Gold Coast, where he relives the fun of 'the roaring twenties' at Oheka Castle, and concludes this leg of his trip at the Montauk lighthouse on Long Island's eastern-most tip

She has chosen this island as it's just a ferry ride from her son and baby grandson, who live in Athens. With a budget of 150,000, Lee lines up five impressive options for her to consider

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows interior designer Kathryn Tyler as she tries to create a Scandinavian-style eco house in her mother's back garden in Falmouth, Cornwall, close by the Lizard Peninsula. The plan is ambitious, featuring a white-painted brick ground floor, a lightweight timber-frame first floor and cleverly designed spaces, but the small size of the plot and Kathryn's inexperience could hamper the project

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Karen and Richard have a large budget but no luck when it comes to making a deal, so they enlist the help of Kirstie Allsopp in their search for a family home in the West Midlands. Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. With Nurse Camilla often working nightshifts, the pair are struggling to fit in some house hunting, after some time with Phil there are two contenders but some quick decisions must be made to avoid losing out yet again

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc: Tim plans to move from his small flat in Bicester into an architecturally daring home at the UK's largest mass self-build site in Graven Hill. With the help of his dad Michael, the project is supposed to be a chance to spend quality time together outside of work but the stress begins to ramp up when the five-tonne car lift Tim ordered from China doesn't fit into the specially prepared hole in the basement. Plus, Kevin and Natasha revisit Jitinder, whose house was unfinished due to the moisture problems and his resin floor last time they met, now they experience the full splendour of his Hollywood Hills style home

programme.title: American Assassin (2017)
programme.desc: After Mitch Rapp's girlfriend Katrina accepts his wedding proposal during an idyllic European beach holiday, they and many others are gunned down by terrorists. Mitch survives and becomes a master of unarmed combat before the US government consider using him for black ops. Action thriller, starring Dylan O'Brien, Michael Keaton and Sanaa Lathan

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. It's nearly the end of the series, and the pressure is so intense that Mae immediately forgets the only rule to a task. Greg demands to be educated about history - but the five comics only seem to know about the year 1066. And there's paint, stomping, poor time-keeping and some impressively sneaky prizes in this quazi semi-final. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Natalie and Tom from Yorkshire arrive at the retreat wanting to spice up their 12-year relationship. Their mismatched sexual histories mean that Natalie arrives with a confidence that Tom might be unable to match. After a flirtatious evening leads to steamy intimacy in the hot tub with residents Josh and Holly, the couple are left questioning everything. Meanwhile, Chanice and Richardo invite 15 of the residents upstairs for an orgy, though being in a room with so many people having sex proves overwhelming for Richardo, so a once-in-a-lifetime experience seems set to pass the couple by

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets 34 year-old Skyla from Kent who runs her own cleaning business and is looking for Mr Right. Zeus, a 27-year-old trans man from Norwich, is new to the dating scene and is looking for someone special to go on this journey with him

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc: A VIP invitation to explore some of the most amazing hotels, villas and island escapes on the planet. This episode explores New York's Mark Hotel and its 55,000-a-night penthouse suite, where Meghan Markle held her baby shower. Next up in the Algarve, Portugal, is the 180,000-a-week Vila Azzurine, where billionaires retreat to when they are looking for some sun and sea, before embarking on a 16,000-a-night ultra-lux safari adventure at the Royal Malewane in South Africa's Kruger National Park. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Beach House in Portland, Dorset, where Pete Lacey feels his back-to-basics approach offers his guests good value. But things get heated with the radiator in Karen and Liam's room and opinions are laid bare over dinner

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the night of the final dinner party in Newcastle and the turn of hotel administrator Vicky to entertain her guests. However, there is tension in the air and the spiritual host is challenged to keep the peace when John lets David know exactly what he thinks of him. The theme of negativity continues as mum-of-three Claire and Liz both take the comedy promoter to task over his questionable sense of humour, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is revealed

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Colin and Mandy kick proceedings off in Bristol with a colourful and spicy assortment of courses, while their guests are treated to a night of conversation about romantic meetings, outrageous shirts and naked gardening. Next, PJ and Owen defy expectations and create a fancy menu, but their purple potato mash is more like play-doh, while Geoff and Gemma round things off with a hearty and rich selection of courses. Who will secure the 1000 prize?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps south London couple Simone and Carlton Campbell search for a new home on Barbados. They have a budget of 150,000 and hope they can achieve their 17-year dream of moving to the island after they enjoyed their first holiday there as a couple, and returned five years later to be married

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of 250,000 can go a long way

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Estate agents the Garners and the Rodriguezes revisit some of their ex-clients to see how their property purchases and lives have been transformed since making the big move from the UK. In Almera, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun Garner catch up with naturists Brian and Hilary who wanted to escape the chilly British weather for a climate that was more compatible with their hobby, while sisters Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez re-visit Ian and Helen who were looking for a holiday home that came with rental potential

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: A family from Manchester juggles renovations and running a holiday complex in France. A couple from Kent prepare to take ownership of a village in Portugal, and the owners of a bed and breakfast in southern France tackle the exterior of their enormous new home

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Sussex to meet Bill and Annie, who have a penchant for Star Wars collectables and most importantly, as far as Henry is concerned, motorbikes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Medical insurance boss Zac Kwintner hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, making a traditional Jewish chicken soup, steak fondue and a rich chocolate orange tart. However, handing over cooking duties to his house staff does not go down well with the guests - a mature student, a travel agent, a web designer and a council worker

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Gerry Hill hosts the second party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to spice up the competition with an Egyptian-themed feast. However, his ambitious menu prompts mixed reactions from the guests, and things go from bad to worse when dinner-table banter turns to insults, and one of the diners is forced to go home early

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Travel agent Kayleigh Hunt hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, but her Moroccan-themed menu fails to impress the diners when she forgets to cook the main course. With all her guests hungry, she resorts to dressing up in her favourite outfits to keep them entertained

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Web designer Marc Harris hosts the penultimate dinner party in Gloucestershire. He is confident his Spanish menu will win over his fellow diners and is determined to put a halt to Zac's rude behaviour, but his plans go downhill when he makes a mess of his starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Council worker Ameena Cott hosts the final dinner party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress with a glamorous evening, which includes colour co-ordinating her dress to match her dog's outfit and making a birdcage centrepiece from a melon. She also tries to win her guests' affections with electric pulse-pad treatment and strawberry face masks, before the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Lee Juggurnauth helps Sarah and Justin locate a suitable a holiday home on Greece's south-west Peloponnese peninsula. The couple met 35 years ago on the beach in Greece, and now with two grown-up daughters, think it's time to buy a property there. They have a budget of 320,000 to work within, so Lee sorts out a number of options for them to consider

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: George meets James, who has bought a former glassworks in Brighton and decided to painstakingly restore the whole property, down to the very last detail. With 500,000 to spend, it should be easy - but as George soon discovers, James never does things the easy way. Will his uncompromising vision live up to his high expectations?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Forty-nine-year-old Nasly is brought into A&E with DKA, a life-threatening complication of diabetes, and Charlie, 72, has severe chest and back pains, although his complicated medical history proves a challenge for the medics. Emergency nurse practitioner Alison is on a busy shift, while explaining how her parents' life in Iran, and the struggles they faced during the revolution, influenced her to get into medicine

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel's attempt to explain how they ended up in bed together descends into an argument about who made the first move - until Ross shocks everyone by announcing he captured the whole encounter on videotape. David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston star

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe finds herself attracted to flighty twin sister Ursula's fiance as the gang has fun at Monica's Halloween party. The Bings dress up as Catwoman and a pink bunny, and Rachel tries to kick-start her maternal instincts with a host of trick-or-treaters. Guest starring Sean Penn

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The programme follows officers from Derbyshire's road crime unit as they target dealers bringing drugs into the county, with PC Nick Lovatt giving chase after a sighting of a suspected dealer in Derby. At police HQ, the cops receive intelligence about a van travelling towards Derbyshire suspected of carrying a large amount of cash. The Road Crime Unit heads into position to intercept the van and surround it on the motorway

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Derbyshire's Road Crime Unit uses intelligence and surveillance tactics to crack down on suspected drug dealers. The team receives some intelligence about a man suspected of ferrying drugs into the county using a relative's car. After boxing the car to a stop, a struggle breaks out between the driver and road crime cop Nick Lovatt, and the suspect is forcibly cuffed and detained

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A case of drink-driving leads to a hot pursuit on the city streets and carnage on the country roads, while a routine stop for speeding gives a lone female officer a worrying surprise. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sgt Jon Moon and his police dog Kanto follow a trail of broken glass and spilt alcohol, leading to a confrontation with a robber wielding a nasty-looking knife. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers step in to deal with a rowdy reveller when things get out of hand on New Year's Eve in Lincoln city centre, while Suzie Ranyard catches out a motorist who claims he has been driving with a dodgy number plate for 18 years. programme.desc: A foul-mouthed pensioner pushes Barry's patience to the limit, Sarah gives a bad-boy biker an early birthday present and Jim's Audi S3 is outclassed by a car 30 years its senior. Plus, Mike is left open-mouthed when he encounters a drink-driver who is three times over the limit

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: Documentary following shopping centre security teams who are locked in a cat and mouse battle to catch criminals

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Marilyn is full of enthusiasm about her new role as a brand ambassador for the skincare company - but she has no idea about online marketing. Ava and Theo resolve their issues

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Ajay Singal is visited by Cyril, an 89-year-old who has a mischievous sense of humour and a loving family around him. Yet when it is time to sleep at night, he gets overwhelmed with anxiety and cannot settle. Can his GP get to the bottom of his problem? Paul comes in complaining of an excruciating pain in his throat, diabetic Paula worries about a sudden dip in her blood sugar levels and railway worker Darren shows Dr Qamar some unsightly lumps on his back

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Siobhan Daniels takes her vehicle to the garage to get the bumper replaced, while G takes his HGV test so he and wife Lamorna can take their revamped double-decker bus out on the road. Sarah and Paul have turned their passion for iconic Airstreams into a business after selling up everything and building a 30-acre retro motorhome resort

As the outnumbered Spartans fight for their country, his queen, Gorgo, tries to rally support for her husband at home. Can Cherry and her experts restore the way they look and feel in just 10 days?

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US marine visits the home of his former captain, only to find the man has been killed, and the killer is waiting inside the property. While the soldier escapes with his life, the attacker gets away too. It quickly emerges the prime suspect is Qasim, an Afghan translator evidence, and evidence points against him, until it is discovered he has a brother, who is loyal to the Taliban. The subsequent chain of evidence leads Gibbs and Bishop to Afghanistan

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Naval intelligence ensign is killed in an unusual car accident. Gibbs and his team are reunited with old friend Ned Dorneget, who is now working with NCIS cyber operations, and NSA attorney Jake Malloy to investigate the case, and discover a conspiracy involving terrorist recruitment on the internet

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Special Agent Ned Dorneget of the NCIS cyber division joins the team to further their investigation into The Calling, the insidious terror network radicalising youngsters via the internet. When it emerges young suicide bomber Bradley was not, in fact, affiliated with The Calling, Gibbs and his colleagues realise they might be back to square-one. Determined to bring the organisation down, the agents pursue two new leads, an arms dealer who may be supplying The Calling with their signature German S-mines, and another boy given a deadly mission by the terrorists. Guest starring Matt Jones

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a violinist with the New York Symphony Orchestra and find the trail leads back to her Svengali-like conductor. However, they have a difficult job getting the case to trial, with a reluctant witness, a suspicious judge and a talented lawyer standing between them and a guilty verdict

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A gang leader is stabbed to death in a prison scuffle, and Briscoe and Green uncover a number of suspects as it becomes clear the victim had numerous enemies on both sides of the law. The investigation results in a charge, but McCoy faces an uphill battle to convict the accused. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a clothes shop owner during an apparent robbery. An open lock suggests someone who works there was responsible, and the trail eventually leads to the son of the dead man's business partner, whose shady dealings were at risk of being exposed. However, the suspect flees to Israel before police have a chance to question him

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An Iraqi immigrant kills a female veteran of the second Gulf War for torturing her brother at Abu Ghraib prison. However, the detectives learn the accused's lawyer plans to defend his client as an enemy combatant, immune from prosecution under the terms of the Geneva Convention, and that they may have no jurisdiction over the case. Starring Jesse L Martin and Dennis Farina

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is accused of murdering her husband's mistress. Although the crime is found to be premeditated, the defendant's lawyer claims his client's actions were prompted by post-traumatic stress syndrome arising from the September 11 terrorist attack. Starring Dennis Farina

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A recently paroled prison gang member is shot dead, and suspicion falls on former crime associates - until his battle behind bars with a corrections officer comes to light. McCoy then learns the defence attorney will claim his client took action to ward off a threat by the con and his 'brotherhood'. Guest starring Candice Bergen

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. When it becomes clear the man was murdered, the subsequent investigation reveals that a previously thwarted human-trafficking ring has been re-established. Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. However, when they return to the surface, they must remain in a high-tech decompression chamber for four days. With each of their suspects confined within a tank, the NCIS team must complete an unorthodox investigation from the outside. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A killer targets the survivors of a high-school massacre when they return to the scene of the tragic event. Meanwhile, Hotch worries his son is being bullied. Drama, starring Thomas Gibson

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman who hosts a talk show that specialises in catching sexual predators is helped by the detectives to apprehend her latest target, but they also discover she has a stalker

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A gruesome work of art in a painter's studio leads to the discovery of a woman's body in the flat above. Benson and Stabler investigate the victim's personal contacts and establish she could have suffered bullying at the wine business she co-founded. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie discover a sinister side to the glamorous world of modelling after a reality TV star dies during a show at New York Fashion Week. Frank tries to clear the name of the family's local priest, and Jamie continues to search for the truth about the Blue Templar. Crime drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg, with Peter Gerety (Rubicon)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny investigates the murder of a tourist while Frank tries to fend off the media's attempts to sensationalise the story. A Haitian man becomes the chief suspect in the case - but neither of the Reagans is convinced of his guilt. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Private Eyes
programme.desc: A high-rise office cleaner witnesses a possible murder in the building next door and hires Shade and Angie to investigate. Willow Maitland tags along to gain first-hand experience of being a PI

programme.title: Private Eyes
programme.desc: Actor Ben Riggs hires Matt and Angie to find out who stole his priceless wristwatch - and what starts off as a hunt for a thief turns into a blackmail case. Can Matt and Angie can discover who is behind the scheme?

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The death of Special Agent Ned Dorneget hits the team hard, and when Gibbs receives a visit from his late colleague's mother - CIA Officer Joanna Teague - he must decide whether to let her help with the investigation into the Calling. Meanwhile, Gibbs hopes his young charge Luke, formerly one of the Calling's radicalised footsoldiers, might be key to bringing the organisation down. However, when the terrorists discover where their defecting comrade has taken refuge, the abduct him and flee to Iraq. The team follows hot on their heels, but it seems Luke's ties to the Calling might be stronger than anyone at NCIS ever anticipated. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with guest Mimi Rogers

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs fights for his life on board a US Navy hospital ship after being shot. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and Joanna Teague head for Shanghai, where they hope to take down the leaders of the terrorist group known as The Calling. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Mimi Rogers

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs throws himself back into his work following his near-death experience, updating his appearance and tackling a new risky case alongside DEA agent Luis Mitchell, who wants help bringing down a drugs cartel. Concerned about his colleague's apparent enthusiasm to re-enter the field, DiNozzo discovers Mitchell is the son of a former NCIS agent who gave his life trying to save Gibbs' late wife and daughter, and this attachment is causing Gibbs to break his own rule against personal involvement in a case. However, a significant danger is posed by Benson Long, the cartel's head, and Mitchell's top target

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Van Buren orders Briscoe and Green to reinvestigate unsolved cases, starting with the murder of a teenager 20 years previously. However, they discover much of the evidence gathered at the time has vanished, and the detective in charge of the case may have pursued an innocent man to protect the real culprit. An unexpected confession allows the case to end up in court again, but legal trickery makes a conviction an unlikely prospect

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man with a history of violence is arrested for the murder of his son's school ice-hockey coach, but pleads mitigating circumstances. Helped by a glib defence lawyer, he claims that he committed the crime while suffering from a previously unknown mental condition he calls 'sports rage'

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. Suspicion soon falls on the husband of one of the victims, who is revealed to have changed his identity to escape a shady past. The shop's security tapes are subsequently discovered in his flat, but the defendant surprises everyone by insisting on representing himself in court - and makes a big impression on the jury

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy discovers two suicide victims were participating in clinical trials of an experimental antidepressant, prompting him to charge the drug company's CEO with second-degree murder. In court the defence argues all medical research carries an element of risk and the judge rules prosecution evidence inadmissible, leaving the outcome on a knife-edge. Sam Waterston and Dennis Farina star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green goes undercover to gather evidence on gun dealers who murdered two detectives during a firearms sting, and McCoy tries to prove a fellow attorney paid the killers to avenge the death of his stepson, who was shot dead in a police operation several years earlier. Crime drama, starring Jesse L Martin and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A famous novelist dies after undergoing plastic surgery, leading to the discovery that her surgeon made a crucial mistake by prescribing a drug that should not have been mixed with the antidepressants she was already taking. McCoy suggests the next of kin prosecute in a civil case, but Southerlyn disagrees and hunts for further evidence of malpractice

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
